cocktails.description: bourbon old fashioned.  2oz bourbon, 1tsp water, 1tsp sugar, 3 Angostura bitters.  So simple, yet so good.  Having this one on a night out with the guys.
vodka martini. I made this one with Grey Goose vodka and Martini dry vermouth.  A lemon twist lightens it right up.  Classy drinks for us ladies tonight!

comments.comment: I like the vodka version better than the gin version

cocktails.description: tequila sour.  I'm not sure how this bartender made this drink but it is absolutely delicious.  Pineapple, lime juice, tequila, some other goodness.  I'll be on my second by the time you read through this.  Haha

gin and tonic. From the officers of the East India Company who had the ingenious idea to sweeten up their malaria prophylaxi quninine tonic with a little gin.  God Bless!  Let's raise a glass and keep malaria-free!

comments.comment: I like my drinks to also give me anti-parasitic properties.  Cheers, mate.

cocktails.description: vodka sour. Pineapple juice, lime juice, vodka, ice.  You can make it fancy, but with fresh ingredients it tastes like just what you needed.  Hanging out by the pool with my friends.  How about you?

comments.comment: This is a nice fresh drink

cocktails.description: Thai Bourbon Old Fashioned.  We're fans of bourbon in general, and old fashioneds specifically.  This is a great little twist on the classic.  Take your classic bourbon, sugar, and angostura bitters and add chocolate bitters, a splash of spiced rum, orange bitters, and Thai lime leaves.  You'll thank me.  This one's already gone.

comments.comment: This version is so good, and a nice little break from the original.
